Important Articles.headline: A decade is a very long time on Wall Street, but I'm confident in my thinking that AGNC Investment's (NASDAQ: AGNC) shares will be worth less than those of Prologis (NYSE: PLD) and Rexford Industrial (NYSE: REXR) in 10 years.  Here's why I believe investors who want a combination of income and capital appreciation will likely be better off with these two property-owning real estate investment trusts over mortgage-focused AGNC.  What does AGNC Investment do?
Important Articles.title: Prediction: 2 Stocks That Will Be Worth More Than AGNC Investment 10 Years From Now

Important Articles.headline: Given that REITs are designed to pass income on to investors in a tax-advantaged manner, it seems logical to believe that the stock, with its huge 14%+ dividend yield, would fit perfectly into a dividend investor's portfolio.  On AGNC Investment's investor services home page, the company tells you exactly what its goal is: "Favorable long-term stockholder returns with a substantial yield component."  For example, on its investor services home page, property-owning REIT Realty Income describes its purpose as follows: "Realty Income is committed to providing our shareholders with dependable monthly dividends through maintaining a conservative capital structure and prudently planning for the sustainable growth of our platform."
Important Articles.title: 58 Monthly Dividends Later and This Ultra-High-Yielder Still Isn't a Dividend Stock You Can Count On

Important Articles.headline: Generating passive income can help increase your financial flexibility.  Investing in dividend stocks can be a very easy way to make passive income.  For example, investing $1,000 into an S&P 500 index fund would produce about $12 of passive dividend income each year, given the index's roughly 1.2% dividend yield.
Important Articles.title: Got $1,000? Here's How to Turn it Into Up to $140 of Passive Income Each Year.

Important Articles.headline: There are warning signs of a possible recession as the U.S. federal government looks to slash jobs, while tariffs could touch off a trade war.  The Atlanta Federal Reserve's estimate for real gross domestic product (GDP) growth for the first quarter has gone from predicting growth of more than 2% in late February to a 2.4% decline as of its last estimate on March 6.  While the specter of a recession is generally not good for the market, there is one high-yielding dividend stock that could perform well in this environment: AGNC Investment (NASDAQ: AGNC).
Important Articles.title: Why This 14%-Yielding Dividend Stock May Perform Well in a Recession

Important Articles.headline: The latest trading day saw AGNC Investment (AGNC) settling at $9.34, representing a -1.48% change from its previous close.
Important Articles.title: AGNC Investment (AGNC) Stock Moves -1.48%: What You Should Know

Important Articles.title: AGNC Investment (AGNC) Laps the Stock Market: Here's Why
